intro: Gomphandra annamensis, commonly known as the Annam gomphandra, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
